text:
Greg Foot: Hey guys, so this is the sixth
explanation video from the 12 Explosions of
Christmas.

I'm Greg -
Mike Sansom: and I'm Mike!

Greg: and this one is six presents exploding,
not what you want under the Christmas tree!
Mike: Not really.

Greg: But it does use one of my favourite
ingredients, liquid nitrogen!
Here it is in the dewar.
Mike: Wow that's cold stuff.
Greg: So what's this stuff coming off?
Everyone thinks this is smoke but it's not.

Mike: It's water vapour, because it's cooling
down the water around that's actual clouds
that you see.

Greg: Yeah so right, what we're gonna do is,
Mike is going to pour that into one of these
bottles that I'm going to be holding.

We're going to put the lid on and then the
atmospheric heat is going to heat up that

liquid nitrogen, it's going to turn into a
gas.

That's going to increase the pressure, the
bottles are going to expand quite lot wouldn't
they?
Mike: They're really going to expand a lot.
Greg: And then it's going to
get
to
the point when they explode!
And it will be six exploding Christmas presents!
Mike: Let's do it!
